org.s2doglm.matrix

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.s2doglm.matrix.Matrix

  • public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object

    S2DOGLM - Simple 2D OpenGL Matrix

    About S2DOGLM

    Created to help me use matrix for 2D OpenGL.
    Containing several simple functions which doesn't contain anything related to Z axis.
    Or at least for now..

    About this class

    Contain several simple functions to create:
    • Translation matrix
    • Dilation matrix
    • Rotation matrix
    • Orthogonal projection matrix

    Author:
    Greffin28
    See Also:
    org.s2doglm.vector.Vec4 Vec4}

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Matrix()
      Calling Matrix() as a constructor will create an identity matrix.
      Matrix(float[] f)
      Calling Matrix(float[] f) as a constructor will create a matrix with the given float array.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Matrix dilationMatrix(float X, float Y, float SX, float SY)
      Dilation matrix relative to (X, Y).

      Example of use:
      Matrix mat = Matrix.dilationMatrix(1.0f, 10.0f, 2.0f, 3.0f);

      static Matrix duplicateMatrix(Matrix oldmat)
      Used to duplicate a matrix.

      Example of use:
      Matrix mat = Matrix.duplicateMatrix(oldMat);

      float[] getMatrix()
      Used to get the current matrix values as a float array.
      java.nio.FloatBuffer getMatrixBuffer()
      Used to get the current matrix values as a FloatBuffer.
      static Matrix oDilationMatrix(float SX, float SY)
      Dilation matrix relative to Origin(0, 0).

      Example of use:
      Matrix mat = Matrix.oDilationMatrix(2.0f, 3.0f);

      static Matrix oRotationMatrix(float ang)
      Rotation matrix relative to Origin(0, 0).

      Example of use:
      Matrix mat = Matrix.oRotationMatrix((float) Math.toRadians(90));

      void printMatrix()
      Used to simply print the matrix values to the console.
      static Matrix rotationMatrix(float X, float Y, float ang)
      Rotation matrix relative to (X, Y).

      Example of use:
      Matrix mat = Matrix.rotationMatrix(1.0f, 10.0f, (float) Math.toRadians(90));

      static Matrix simpleOrtho(float l, float t, float r, float b)
      Simple orthogonal matrix which doesn't interfere with Z axis.

      Example of use:
      Matrix mat = Matrix.simpleOrtho(0, 0, 600, 800);

      void transform(Matrix matT)
      Used to transform the current vector by multiplying a transformation matrix with the current vector itself.
      Example: if it is A.transform(B); Then it is matrix B * A.
      static Matrix translationMatrix(float X, float Y)
      Translation matrix.

      Example of use:
      Matrix mat = Matrix.translationMatrix(5.0f, 10.0f);

      void transpose()
      Calling transpose() will transpose the current matrix.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Matrix

        public Matrix()
        Calling Matrix() as a constructor will create an identity matrix.

      • Matrix

        public Matrix(float[] f)
        Calling Matrix(float[] f) as a constructor will create a matrix with the given float array. The float array must be 4 * 4 in size in column major orientation.

    • Method Detail

      • transpose

        public void transpose()
        Calling transpose() will transpose the current matrix.

      • transform

        public void transform(Matrix matT)
        Used to transform the current vector by multiplying a transformation matrix with the current vector itself.
        Example: if it is A.transform(B); Then it is matrix B * A.

        Parameters:
        mat - Matrix that will be multiplied by the current vector.

      • simpleOrtho

        public static Matrix simpleOrtho(float l,
                                 float t,
                                 float r,
                                 float b)
        Simple orthogonal matrix which doesn't interfere with Z axis.

        Example of use:
        Matrix mat = Matrix.simpleOrtho(0, 0, 600, 800);

        Parameters:
        l - Left side.
        t - Top side.
        r - Right side.
        b - Bottom side.
        Returns:
        Matrix

      • rotationMatrix

        public static Matrix rotationMatrix(float X,
                                    float Y,
                                    float ang)
        Rotation matrix relative to (X, Y).

        Example of use:
        Matrix mat = Matrix.rotationMatrix(1.0f, 10.0f, (float) Math.toRadians(90));

        Parameters:
        X - Horizontal coordinate of the rotation point.
        Y - Vertical coordinate of the rotation point.
        ang - Angle of rotation in radians.
        Returns:
        Matrix

        Example of use:
        Matrix mat = Matrix.oRotationMatrix((float) Math.toRadians(90));

        Parameters:
        ang - Angle of rotation in radians.
        Returns:
        Matrix

        Example of use:
        Matrix mat = Matrix.dilationMatrix(1.0f, 10.0f, 2.0f, 3.0f);

        Parameters:
        X - Horizontal coordinate of the dilation point.
        Y - Vertical coordinate of the dilation point.
        SX - Horizontal scale.
        SY - Vertical scale.
        Returns:
        Matrix
